EASI.name: EASI
EASI.description: Physician-assessed measure of atopic dermatitis severity combining extent (body surface area) and intensity (erythema, induration, excoriation, lichenification) across 4 body regions.
EASI.scoring: 0-72 scale; higher = more severe. Mild: 1-7, Moderate: 7-21, Severe: 21-50, Very Severe: >50

interpretation.EASI-50: ≥50% reduction from baseline - clinically meaningful improvement
interpretation.EASI-75: ≥75% reduction from baseline - significant improvement, often used as primary endpoint

EASI.regulatory_status: FDA-accepted primary endpoint for AD trials

SCORAD.name: SCORAD
SCORAD.description: Composite score combining objective physician assessment (extent, intensity) with subjective patient symptoms (itch, sleep loss).
SCORAD.interpretation: Captures both objective disease AND patient experience; more holistic than EASI alone

vIGA-AD.name: vIGA-AD
vIGA-AD.full_name: Validated Investigator Global Assessment for Atopic Dermatitis
vIGA-AD.description: Physician's overall assessment of AD severity on a 5-point scale.
vIGA-AD.regulatory_status: FDA co-primary endpoint for AD (with EASI-75)

PPNRS.name: PP-NRS
PPNRS.description: Patient-reported measure of worst itch intensity in the past 24 hours.
PPNRS.scoring: 0-10 scale; 0 = no itch, 10 = worst imaginable itch
PPNRS.clinical_relevance: Itch is the most bothersome symptom for AD patients; strongly impacts quality of life and sleep

POEM.name: POEM
POEM.description: 7-item questionnaire measuring AD symptoms and their frequency over the past week.
POEM.scoring: 0-28; higher = more severe. Mild: 3-7, Moderate: 8-16, Severe: 17-24, Very Severe: 25-28
POEM.mcid: ≥4-point improvement is Minimum Clinically Important Difference
POEM.clinical_relevance: Captures patient's experience of disease impact on daily life

DLQI.name: DLQI
DLQI.description: 10-question validated questionnaire measuring impact of skin disease on quality of life.
DLQI.scoring: 0-30; higher = greater impairment. 0-1: no effect, 2-5: small, 6-10: moderate, 11-20: large, 21-30: extremely large
DLQI.mcid: ≥4-point improvement is Minimum Clinically Important Difference
DLQI.clinical_relevance: Measures impact on work, relationships, daily activities, treatment burden

FEV1.name: FEV1
FEV1.description: Volume of air that can be forcibly exhaled in one second. Gold standard measure of airway obstruction.
FEV1.measurement: Spirometry; expressed as absolute (L) or % predicted for age/height/sex
FEV1.pre_vs_post_bronchodilator: Pre-BD measures baseline obstruction; Post-BD shows reversibility
FEV1.regulatory_status: FDA-accepted primary endpoint for asthma trials

ACQ-5.name: ACQ-5
ACQ-5.description: 5-item questionnaire assessing asthma symptom control over past week.
ACQ-5.scoring: 0-6 scale; lower = better control. <0.75: well-controlled, 0.75-1.5: partly controlled, >1.5: uncontrolled
ACQ-5.clinical_relevance: Captures real-world symptom burden and control

FeNO.name: FeNO
FeNO.description: Measures nitric oxide in exhaled breath, a marker of eosinophilic airway inflammation.
FeNO.measurement: Parts per billion (ppb) via exhaled breath analyzer
FeNO.clinical_relevance: Predicts response to IL-4/IL-13 pathway therapies; marker of Type 2 inflammation in airways

anti-dsDNA.name: Anti-dsDNA
anti-dsDNA.description: Autoantibodies targeting double-stranded DNA; highly specific for systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE).
anti-dsDNA.measurement: ELISA, Farr assay, or immunofluorescence; reported as titer or units
anti-dsDNA.clinical_relevance: Elevated in 70-80% of SLE patients; correlates with disease activity and lupus nephritis risk
anti-dsDNA.interpretation: Reduction indicates decreased autoimmune activity and potential disease modification

joint_swelling.name: Joint Swelling
joint_swelling.description: Number of joints with clinically detectable swelling (synovitis).
joint_swelling.measurement: Physical examination of 66 joints (SJC66) or 28 joints (SJC28)
joint_swelling.clinical_relevance: Direct measure of active inflammation; reduction indicates therapeutic benefit
